Groundwater evaluation Tool - The GET Tool is designed to provide statistical analysis of groundwater monitoring data required under State regulatory programs and the federal Coal Combustion Residuals (CCR) rule. It uses state-of-the-art statistical and predictive methods to evaluate geochemical and geotechnical data under three phases of groundwater monitoring: Detection, Assessment, and Corrective Action. In “Detection”, background data is used to construct prediction limits for use in identifying statistically significant changes from background levels. In “Assessment” and “Corrective Action”, compliance data is used to compute confidence intervals and confidence bands to assess violations of groundwater protection standards (GWPS) to inform of corrective action needs.
The Groundwater Modeling Evaluation Tool (GMET) is an R Shiny application that uses Phreeqc geochemical models and analysis to evaluate groundwater chemistry data at each of TVA’s CCR sites

Datum is a virtual knowledge employee for Teams. The system can search data and provide analysis, it can be taught any additional knowledge within the group’s data or the group’s objective s and can generate reports and output along with analysis on the output. The system can also create new work the same way an Analyst can using the internal data to transform it to desired output. For example, the system can get your unit data and run a unit commitment on it and then analyze the output. You can refine it by giving it input in English. The final product can be saved so other users can use the same instructions (it can take inputs though of dates/units, etc. that you specify so users can run it with different input each time). It will simulate having your own internal Analyst and IT resource in one.
